sn21.11:4.2: Then Venerable Mahākappina went to see the Buddha.
sn21.11:4.3: The Buddha saw him coming off in the distance,
sn21.11:4.5: “Mendicants, do you you see that monk coming—white, thin, with a pointy nose?”
sn21.11:4.7: “That mendicant is very mighty and powerful. It’s not easy to find an attainment that he has not already attained.
sn21.11:4.9: And he has realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lives having achieved with his own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”
sn21.11:5.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn21.11:5.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn21.11:6.1: “The aristocrat is best of those people
sn21.11:6.2: who take clan as the standard.
sn21.11:6.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
sn21.11:6.4: is best of gods and humans.
sn21.11:7.4: and the brahmin shines in absorption.
sn21.11:7.5: But all day and all night,
